intro: Barleria glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins and glandular dots, which give it its scientific name. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually purple or pink and bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
